channel.title: [317 PI] Help
channel.description:
I've almost added an auto CacheDownloader and I'm only having one problem, I think.
[IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/33dcp3r.png[/img]
It starts to download the Cache, but then it fails. Can someone please help me? and don't laugh at me, because I am new to Java. ^_^

item.title: [317 PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

May I see the whole cache download class and lines 4000-4200 & 9400-9500 of the client class?

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @daves_skill daves skill
item.description:
@daves_skill wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:539991”][quote author=daves skill link=topic=658841.msg4406802#msg4406802 date=1392244013]
Thanks

Btw, do I have to do anything server-side to get the auto-cache working?
[/quote]I’m assuming it’s already built-in in your case, so no you just need to verify it’s working - if it is then you just need to fix the unzipping process. If it isn’t then you will need to rewrite all/parts of it. Good luck.[/quote]

It starts to download the Cache, but then once it’s finish it’ll come up with the picture shown in the Thread.

And now I’ve got this http://gyazo.com/f13d83978cd2d7068e6d4ca6cf35bc35

Sorry to ask again, but does this look right to you? http://gyazo.com/4e99d933235ecab33ea1e377275192ec

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“daves skill, post:3, topic:539991”]Thanks

Btw, do I have to do anything server-side to get the auto-cache working?[/quote]I’m assuming it’s already built-in in your case, so no you just need to verify it’s working - if it is then you just need to fix the unzipping process. If it isn’t then you will need to rewrite all/parts of it. Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @daves_skill daves skill
item.description:
@daves_skill wrote:

Thanks

Btw, do I have to do anything server-side to get the auto-cache working?

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Unzipping the file is clearly erroneous, make sure the bytes your server are sending to your client to reconstruct as a zip file are valid (in said format).

Read full topic
